title: Analysts explain why Mariupol is crucial to Putin's plans
description: CNN's Brian Todd and military analyst retired Col. Cedric Leighton explain why the city of Mariupol is such a crucial target for Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: See how Ukrainian soldiers disposes of land mines
description: CNN's Phil Black travels with Ukrainian soldiers that are collecting the active munitions Russian forces left behind.

title: The rise and fall of RT America, the Russia-backed TV network
description: RT America sold conspiracy theories and alternative facts under the slogan "Question More." Now it's a casualty of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Reality Check's John Avlon talks with CNN media correspondent Oliver Darcy about how RT America pushed misinformation to the far right and far left - and what can be done to stop propaganda from spreading.

title: Lamborghini's last Aventador Coupé with an NFT sold for $1.6M
description: Lamborghini auctioned off the last Aventador Ultimate Coupé it will ever produce for $1.6 million, along with an exclusive NFT designed for the metaverse.

title: US Air Force creates new weapons system 'Phoenix Ghost'
description: The additional $800 million aid package for Ukraine announced by President Biden will include a new drone system designed by the US Air Force called the "Phoenix Ghost." CNN's Barbara Starr reports.

title: College pitcher levels baserunner after giving up home run
description: A pitcher from a junior college baseball team in Texas is facing potential expulsion after he attacked an opposing baserunner during a game.

title: CNN+ will shut down at the end of April
description: CNN+, the streaming service that was hyped as one of the most significant developments in the history of CNN, will shut down on April 30, just one month after it launched.

title: Johnny Depp cross-examined in defamation case against Amber Heard
description: Johnny Depp is testifying for a third day in a Fairfax, Virginia court in his defamation case against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

title: Boris Johnson is to face another 'Partygate' investigation
description: Boris Johnson will face a third investigation into whether he knowingly misled parliament when he denied that any rules were broken in Downing Street after stories emerged of lockdown breaking parties and gatherings taking place during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Explosions in northern Afghanistan kill at least 15 people, ​injure ​dozens
description: Separate explosions in northern Afghanistan on Thursday have killed at least 15 people and left dozens more injured, local officials said.

title: Ex-CIA head reacts to audio purporting Russian troops feeling abandoned
description: Former CIA Director Gen. David Petraeus (Ret.) reacts to purported intercepted communication between Russian soldiers expressing their frustration towards their commanders.

title: Serena Williams and Lewis Hamilton join consortium to buy Chelsea
description: Twenty-three-time grand slam champion Serena Williams and seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton have joined Martin Broughton's bid to buy Premier League club Chelsea, a source close to the bid told CNN Sport on Thursday.

title: Novak Djokovic calls Wimbledon ban on Russian and Belarusian players 'crazy'
description: Twenty-time grand slam champion Novak Djokovic has criticized the decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from competing at Wimbledon this year, calling the move "crazy."

title: Biden announces new Ukraine security assistance: 'We will speak softly and carry a large javelin'
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday announced another package of weapons and other aid will be sent to to Ukraine in the administration's latest efforts to reinforce the country's forces battling against Russia's invasion.

title: Supreme Court rules Puerto Ricans don't have constitutional right to some federal benefits
description: Congress can exclude residents of Puerto Rico from some federal disability benefits available to those who live in the 50 states, the Supreme Court ruled Thursday.

title: How Piers Morgan just handed Trump an easy win
description: The clip seemed shocking.

title: Robert Morse, star of 'Mad Men' and Broadway, dies at 90
description: Robert Morse, a Broadway star best known to TV viewers as "Mad Men" boss Bertram Cooper, has died. He was 90.

title: Mitch McConnell calls Donald Trump's bluff in Alaska
description: In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza breaks down how Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell isn't backing down from his standoff with former President Donald Trump in Alaska's Senate race.

title: An incredibly damning quote from Mitch McConnell on January 6
description: Mitch McConnell knew that what happened on January 6, 2021, was deeply wrong. And that blame for the riot that day lay at the feet of then-President Donald Trump.

title: We shouldn't trust Musk's plans to transform Twitter
Navalny's daughter gets emotional talking about her father's return to Russia
description: "Navalny" premieres Sunday, April 24, at 9 p.m. ET on CNN and CNN+. The fly-on-the-wall documentary follows Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny through his political rise, poisoning and search for the truth.

title: Putin rattles his 'Satan II' nuclear saber to hide Russian failures in Ukraine war: analysts
description: Vladimir Putin did his best to put a menacing spin on Russia's testing of a new intercontinental ballistic missile on Wednesday.

title: Analysis: Pushed back from Kyiv, what's Russia's military plan?
description: Phase two of Russia's invasion of Ukraine -- an offensive in the eastern Donbas region -- is underway. The question is whether it will be any more successful and competent than phase one, and whether Ukraine will have enough troops and weapons to impede or even block it.

title: Buckle up: The Fed is about to get tough on inflation
description: Last month, the Federal Reserve raised interest rates for the first time since December 2018. Now there are growing expectations that the central bank is about to dramatically step up the size and pace of its rate hikes in order to put a brake on surging consumer prices.

title: Jada Pinkett Smith (kind of) addresses the slap in 'Red Table Talk' return
description: Jada Pinkett Smith is back with her "Red Table Talk" for Season 5.

title: Honolulu is leading the way for solar power. Here's how other US cities rank
description: Solar energy is booming in America's cities.

title: The head of Russia's second biggest oil company has quit
description: One of Russia's richest men has quit as CEO of Lukoil, the country's second-largest oil company.

title: After two years of losses, airlines expect record revenue
description: After two years of massive losses, US airlines are about to start reporting profits once again.

title: Clashes erupt in Jerusalem, Israel responds to Gaza rockets with airstrikes
description: Palestinians and Israeli security forces clashed early Thursday around the entrance to the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem's Old City and Israel responded to rockets fired from Gaza with airstrikes, as the worst tensions in months continued to simmer.

title: This social app prohibits edited photos to encourage users to be more authentic. It's growing fast
description: Scoot over, Facebook and Instagram.

title: Prehistoric humans turned their campfires into makeshift movie theaters
description: Our Stone Age ancestors didn't just share stories by the side of a fire -- they may have watched them too.

title: Why Tesla's stock is still defying gravity
description: Investors have quickly turned on companies like Netflix that were growing fast during the recovery from the pandemic but are now sputtering. Yet Tesla, which skeptics have long said is overvalued based on rosy projections for the future, is experiencing a much softer landing.

title: Watch: Rudy Giuliani revealed as 'The Masked Singer' contestant
description: The former New York City mayor and former attorney to former President Donald Trump was unmasked from the Jack in the Box costume, prompting one of the judges to walk off stage.

title: Some big Indian businesses are joining the exodus from Russia
description: Two of India's biggest businesses are moving away from Russia, even as Prime Minister Narendra Modi refrains from taking a tough stance against Moscow over the war in Ukraine.

title: Queen Elizabeth celebrates 96th birthday in milestone jubilee year
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II celebrated her 96th birthday on Thursday, in the same year that marks her 70 years on the throne.

title: Macron vs. Le Pen: What are French people expecting?
Zelensky's reaction to Trump's 2019 remark gets renewed attention
description: An interaction between President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodomyr Zelensky resurfaced online and is getting renewed attention after Putin's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Shanghai health workers broke down door of 92-year-old to take her into quarantine
description: The men came after 2 a.m. on Tuesday in the dead of the night, banging on an apartment door in a rundown housing complex in Shanghai. When nobody answered, they pried open the lock and barged in, rousing a 92-year-old woman from her bed.

title: Decision fatigue can make the smallest choices feel overwhelming. Here's how to find relief
description: Do I want to work out today? Should I go to the gym? Should I take a class? Do I have time to work out?

title: Erik ten Hag announced as Manchester United manager
description: Erik ten Hag is joining Manchester United as the men's first team manager, from the end of this season until June 2025, with the option to extend for a further year, the club announced Thursday.

title: Chicago O'Hare Airport: Congested, poor customer satisfaction -- and now a $8.5 billion makeover
description: The city of Chicago has long had one of the world's busiest airport systems.

title: No 'gotcha moments': CNN reporter breaks down French presidential debate
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and his far-right challenger Marine Le Pen went head-to-head in a televised debate days before a run-off in the presidential election. CNN's Jim Bittermann reports.

title: Inside Alexander Wang's controversial return to the runway
description: It almost felt like a pre-pandemic fashion event. The cool kids gathered inside Los Angeles' Chinatown Central Plaza, without masks, on Tuesday to check out Fortune City, an event and runway show pegged as a celebration of Asian American food, culture and music, hosted by Alexander Wang. The designer was making his return to the runway after an almost three-year-long pause of catwalk events.

title: Joel Embiid hits last second game-winning three in OT to give Philadelphia 76ers series lead over Toronto Raptors
description: Joel Embiid hit a clutch three pointer with less than a second remaining to seal a 104-101 overtime win for the Philadelphia 76ers, extending their first round series lead over the Toronto Raptors to 3-0 in the NBA Eastern Conference playoffs.

title: Shohei Ohtani has brush with perfection in history-making evening for Los Angeles Angels star
description: Shohei Ohtani had a brush with perfection on Wednesday night on a history-making evening.

title: Australian scientists to fit Tesla with printed solar panels in 15,000km test ride
description: Scientists in Australia are testing printed solar panels to power a Tesla on a 15,100-km (9,400-mile) journey beginning in September, which they hope will get the public thinking about steps to help avert climate change.

title: World's tallest timber residential tower to be built
description: Switzerland is set to become home to the world's tallest timber residential building.

title: Taiwan investigates local TV network after it aired false reports of Chinese invasion
description: The Taiwanese government is investigating a local TV news station after it aired alarming false reports of a Chinese invasion against the self-ruled island.

title: His house was demolished because he is Muslim, he says
description: Shahdullah Baig stands among the rubble of what was once his modest two-bedroom home, his belongings buried under debris and broken bricks.

title: Survivors in Kyiv detail brutal attack from Russian forces
description: CNN's Phil Black speaks with residents in Kyiv, Ukraine, whose lives changed forever after surviving brutal attacks by Russian forces.

title: See moment Shanghai residents confront police over Covid tactics
description: After a weeks-long Covid lockdown, residents in Shanghai, China, are upset and have begun confronting police over Covid tactics. CNN's David Culver reports.

title: Russian billionaire criticizes Putin, calling war 'insane'
description: Russian business tycoon Oleg Tinkov has blasted the war in Ukraine, criticizing Russian President Vladimir Putin and other Kremlin officials while calling the war "insane." CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

title: 'An introvert and an extrovert': Jen Psaki on working with Biden and Obama
description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki talks about the difference between working with President Joe Biden and former President Barack Obama. "Who's Talking to Chris Wallace?" is available on CNN+ — CNN's new subscription streaming service.
